meanings.sent1: She musiced on her guitar all night long.
meanings.sent2: The band musiced beautifully at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The cat musicked along to the sound of the wind chimes.
meanings.sent4: The trees musicked a gentle tune as the wind rustled through their leaves.
meanings.sent5: The children musicked joyfully in the school orchestra.

meanings.sent1: He musicked with his friends in a band.
meanings.sent2: The community musicked together during the music festival.
meanings.sent3: The birds musicked in harmony in the early morning.
meanings.sent4: The waves musicked a soothing melody as they crashed on the shore.
meanings.sent5: The family musicked around the campfire, singing songs and playing instruments.

meanings.definition: To provide or accompany with music.
meanings.sent1: The pianist musiced the ballet performance.
meanings.sent2: The orchestra musiced the silent film with a live score.
meanings.sent3: The rain musicked a rhythmic beat on the roof of the house.
meanings.sent4: The stars musicked a twinkling tune in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The street musician musicked the bustling city square with his saxophone.
